title: My father loves football, but it may have cost him his mind
text:
Chris Stokel-Walker talks to the families of former players suffering dementia after a study revealed a link to heightened risks

It was when John Garwood was driving down the A30 in the wrong direction last year that his family knew something was wrong.

The former Daily Mail worker had spent a life playing football and loving sport. A life-long Milwall fan, Garwood had played for the club’s support sides, as well as Wimbledon and Falmouth Town after moving to Cornwall in the early 1960s.

“He was a proper old-school player,” says his daughter, Hayley Wood, who was regaled with stories of broken legs and full-body tackles when she was growing up.
